subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: .....then why do I feel guilty?
author: psfponies
full_text:
--0-415777862-1208889118=:35762
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=iso-8859-1
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 8bit

"Seek people of like mind and spiritual nature and you can't go wrong." 
   
  Very well said Frank R
   
  Kay

Frank Ratka <warrior18eii@...> wrote:
          Look, if you look around it won't take long before you find this type of hate laden speech. It stems from fear and misunderstanding. It is invited by those who seek validation. You can explain to them your ideas till your blue in the face and they still won't get it.

My point is, don't try to convince the unconvincible. Seek people of like mind and spiritual nature and you can't go wrong. I remember reading this blog among others and I have to say, I am not impressed by their logic or argument. Follow your own path.

Regards,

Frank R.

  ----- Original Message ----
From: juli velazquez <ghostchasingfool@...>
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Tuesday, April 22, 2008 12:55:36 PM
Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: .....then why do I feel guilty?

    
  That was the very point with my previous post I was trying make!  But little old me knows nothing, hummmm!
   
  I guess Frank is the only one who people choose not to listen to.  Maybe he is a wise old owl (no pund intended Frank on the old part, lol).
   
  Juli

Regan <haunt.seeker@ yahoo.com> wrote:
      This is all I've got to say about this:

http://blog. myspace.com/ reaprulz

We have been attacked with every posting of our box, ever clip we've 
posted, every discussion we've posted.

Personally insulted, threat and hate mail has been recieved.

:: shakes head ::
